reviews.text: Lovely little station. Closed when we discovered it very early on a Sunday morning but fascinating to discover its famous clock & clash of period architecture.
Good atmosphere. Good station cafe made famous by the brief encounter film. The heritage centre is worth a visit.

A railway station with a museum and refreshment bar on the platform.  The refreshment bar serves a good range of meals, cakes and drinks which are very nice and well presented.  The staff were helpful.  The museum centres on the film Brief Encounters which was filmed at the station.  It also has a lot of memrobria from the station and surrounding stations. There is a small gift shop as well.  There is a car park which was a minimum of £4 when we visited although we parked on the road as it was Sunday and not very busy.
 Good food, interesting museum, clean toilets worth a visit if you are in the area.

Historic station with a great exhibition to the film 'A Brief Encounter'. 
Not sure why this station has fallen into the disrepair it has given the historic interest. 
Services are limited to Lancashire and The Lakes coastal line. There is information here for passengers and it is conveniently located for Carnforth.
The station has disabled access. No toilets though.
Great day out in david lean museum.
